Package ss.pentago.network.client

Class OfflineClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.pentago.network.client.Client
      • ss.pentago.network.client.OfflineClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class OfflineClient
extends Client
    An offline client to play the game.

      OfflineClient​(Player player1, Player player2, boolean shuffleOrder)
      After creating a new instance of OfflineClient, the intended use is to call Client.addListener(ClientListener) and Client.setInputHandler(InputHandler).

    • Constructor Detail

      • OfflineClient

        public OfflineClient​(Player player1,
                     Player player2,
                     boolean shuffleOrder)
        After creating a new instance of OfflineClient, the intended use is to call Client.addListener(ClientListener) and Client.setInputHandler(InputHandler).
        Parameters:
        player1 - the first player
        player2 - the second player
        shuffleOrder - whether to randomly shuffle the starting player

    • Method Detail

      • getMove

        public Move getMove()
        Return the move the current player would make, for an AIPlayer it's their move, for a HumanPlayer, this method returns the move their hint AI would play.
        Specified by:
        getMove in class Client
        Returns:
        null when not in a game or a HumanPlayer has no hints left, the move otherwise

      • updateGame

        public void updateGame​(Move move)
        Update the game and inform the listeners of the board change. This method is synchronized for the OfflineClient, since the thread running the OfflineTextInputHandler also access this method, while trying to modify the game.
        Specified by:
        updateGame in class Client
        Parameters:
        move - the move to update the game with

      • delayAI

        public void delayAI()
        Delay this thread for an amount specified by Config.getResponseDelaySinglePlayer. This method should be called before an AI performs a move.

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the pentago game main loop.
        First the (still empty) board is shown. Then the game is played until it is over. Players can make a move when it's their turn. In every change in board (including placing marble and rotating the board) , the changed game situation is printed.

      • close

        public void close()
        Perform a clean up when this Client shuts down. By default this clears the ClientListeners associated with this Client, and sets the game to null. This method is synchronized for the OfflineClient, since the thread running the OfflineTextInputHandler also access this method, while trying to modify the game.
        This method is overridden to provide clearer documentation specific to this class, but the functionality is exactly the same as Client's close method.
        Overrides:
        close in class Client

      • getCurrentGame

        public Game getCurrentGame()
        Overrides:
        getCurrentGame in class Client
        Returns:
        the game that is currently being played, null if no game is played right now

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String "OfflineClient"
